identificationModule.briefTitle: Descriptive Analysis of Real-world Data Collected With ME&MGopen
identificationModule.officialTitle: Descriptive Analysis of Real-world Data Collected With the ME&MGopen Mobile Application Developed for Myasthenia Gravis Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The ME\&MGopen smartphone application is an investigational software for research purposes only, developed by Ad Scientiam. It features digital tests to assess the respiratory capacity ("My Breathing" Test), dysarthria ("My Voice" Test), ptosis ("My eyelids" test), as well as upper and lower limb muscle function ("My arms" Test and "My legs" Test). The mobile app also includes e-questionnaires related to activities of daily living, pain, insomnia, quality of life and depression. The objectives of the study are to collect data on patients' symptoms with the application in a real life setting, to assess adherence to the use of the tool, user experience and satisfaction with the application, and safety of use.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The ME\&MGopen smartphone application is an investigational software for research purposes only, developed by Ad Scientiam. It features digital tests to assess the respiratory capacity ("My Breathing" Test), dysarthria ("My Voice" Test), ptosis ("My eyelids" test), as well as upper and lower limb muscle function ("My arms" Test and "My legs" Test). The mobile app also includes e-questionnaires related to activities of daily living, pain, insomnia, quality of life and depression.

The objectives of the study are to collect data on patients' symptoms with the application in a real life setting, to assess adherence to the use of the tool, user experience and satisfaction with the application, and safety of use.

Analyses will also be performed to identify factors that may influence these parameters and provide levers for understanding and improvement. The existence of a possible learning effect on active testing will also be explored as a data point of interest.

The results will allow researchers to extend their knowledge of gMG from real-life data and of the use of digital tools in a gMG patient population

armGroups.label: ME&MGopen
armGroups.description: Use of ME\&MGopen mobile app, at home for 12 months

interventions.name: ME&MGopen smartphone application
interventions.description: Smartphone application includes digital tests and e-questionnaires

primaryOutcomes.measure: To describe real-life upper limb weakness mesurements
primaryOutcomes.description: Time in seconds measured with the ME\&MGopen smartphone application (holding the phone in one arm for as long as possible)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: To describe real-life lower limb weakness measurements
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of sit-to-stand actions measured with the ME\&MGopen smartphone application (1 minute sit-to-stand test)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Margin-Reflex Distance 1 (MRD1) measured with the ME\&MGopen smartphone application
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Time in seconds measured with the ME\&MGopen smartphone application
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: To describe real-life respiratory capacity measurements
primaryOutcomes.description: Time in seconds measured with the ME\&MGopen smartphone application : saying "aaaaahhh" for as long as possible
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: To describe activities of daily living
primaryOutcomes.description: Myasthenia Gravis Activities of Daily Living scores (0-24) higher score meaning a worse outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Patient Health Questionnaire-8 (0-12) higher score meaning a worse outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Pain Likert scale scores(0-10) higher score meaning a worse outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Insomnia Severity Index scores (0-28) higher score meaning a worse outcome, 0-7 = No clinically significant insomnia 8-14 = Subthreshold insomnia 15-21 = Clinical insomnia (moderate severity) 22-28 = Clinical insomnia (severe)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: To describe quality of life related to MG
primaryOutcomes.description: Myasthenia Gravis Quality of Life 15-item Scale revised scores (0-30) higher score meaning a worse outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

primaryOutcomes.description: 36-Item Short Form Survey version 1 (0-100) higher score meaning a better outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the reliability of the digital tests performed at home in real-life
secondaryOutcomes.description:
The intraclass correlation coefficient mean k raters (ICCk; k=month) will be used to assess the monthly reliability at home of digital tests from the beginning to the end of participation :

At-home MET At-home MBT At-home MVT At-home MAT At-home MLT
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, month 1, month 2, month 3, Month 4, month 5, month 6, month 7, month 8, month 9, month 10, month 11, month 12

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To assess adherence to the mobile application
secondaryOutcomes.description: Descriptive analysis of the mobile application's adherence data (number of completed questionnaires, carried tests, number of sessions performed etc.)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To assess the satisfaction and user experience with the smartphone application
secondaryOutcomes.description: Descriptive analysis (counts/percentages) of the answers to the user experience and satisfaction questionnaires related to the use of the ME\&MGopen smartphone application

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To assess safety of use of the smartphone application
secondaryOutcomes.description: Descriptive analysis of adverse events (AEs) related and unrelated to the use of the application. Adverse event data will be reported in a table and expressed as number and percentage, differentiating mild, moderate and severe AEs.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the effect of different frequencies of assessments of the digitals tests on the onset of learning effect
To analyze correlations between digital tests, e-questionnaires, socio demographic data, treatments
secondaryOutcomes.description: Matrix correlation to estimate Pearson's correlation coefficient for each pair of relevant variables.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the ability of the Health Belief Model to predict user behavior towards the smartphone application
secondaryOutcomes.description: coefficient of correlation between dimensions of the Health Belief Model and device use

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To identify if socio-demographic data, treatment status, severity, satisfaction and user experience could influence the results to the digital tests and questionnaires
To identify if socio-demographic data, treatment status, severity, satisfaction and user experience could influence the reliability of the digital tests
To identify if depression , activities of daily living and satisfaction could influence the adherence to the smartphone application
To identify if socio-demographic data or treatment status could influence satisfaction with the smartphone application
To explore the existing association between the ME&MG tests scores obtained at home and the results labeled by a trained evaluator

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Aged 18 + years old
* Diagnosis of gMG with positive serologic test for anti-AChR autoantibody at screening
* Who has read the information sheet and signed the informed consent form
* Owns a personal smartphone which version is above 14 for IOS and 8 for Android included
* Able to use a smartphone
* Able to perform the ME\&MG tests (based on investigator's judgment)
* Able to read language in which the mobile application is available (English, Spanish, German) and able to understand pictograms

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participating in another ME\&MG trial
* Aged 17 years or younger
* A medical, psychological, or behavioral condition which interferes with compliance
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Adults living with generalized Myasthenia Gravis in the US and in Canada

locations.facility: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

ancestors.term: Autoimmune Diseases of the Nervous System

browseLeaves.name: Autoimmune Diseases of the Nervous System
